result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason J. Hyatt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jason J. Hyatt is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jason J. Hyatt was found guilty of 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.30(2).
  • Jason J. Hyatt was found guilty of False Imprisonment [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.30.
  • Jason J. Hyatt was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
*Not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
*Not eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence the defendant is currently serving

superMiscConds.notes:
*Pay costs
*Pay DNA Surchare
*Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
*50% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
*Once released obtain and maintain full time employment

*Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
*Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
*Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
*Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

*Court will order restitution but will give time for defendant to review the claim, will give 30 days in which to respond **Order for Restitution /s/ TBE 04/17/17.
*Make monthly payments toward restitution if there is restitution and court ordered obligations.
*Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.
*Complete Domestic Violence Treatment Program.
*Participate and comply with Cognitive Intervention Treatment Program. 
*Obtain a psychologial evaluation and comply with treatment recommendations as recommended by the agent. 
*Participate in and comply with other assessments and treatment as recommended by the agent.
*No contact with J.N. or her family or her residence or their places of employment except that defendant may write a letter of apology and present to agent. 
*Provide DNA sample

*Pay restitution to Crime Victim Compensation Program in the amount of $24,221.25 and this is to be paid FIRST
*Pay restitution to Wisconsin Casualty Recovery - HMS in the amount of $17.32 and this is to be paid SECOND
*Pay restitution to Security Health Plan in the amount of $3,817.37 and this is to be paid THIRD

records.addlTxt: IT IS ORDERED that the petition for review filed by defendant-appellant, Jason J Hyatt, pro-se, is summarily dismissed.

IT IS ORDERED that the motion is GRANTED.   Defendant-Appellant, Jason J Hyatt, may file an additional statement in support of the petition for review filed March 4, 2021, conforming to the requirements of Wis Stat 809.62(2) and (4), by April 30, 2021.  Mr Hyatt is advised that this is a one-time exception to the admonition in our March 11, 2021 order that no further time extensions would be granted.  No extensions of the April 30, 2021 deadline will be permitted, and a failure to meet this deadline will result in summary dismissal.

IT IS ORDERED that a statement in support of the petition, conforming to the requirement s of Wis Stat 809.62(2) and (4), must be filed with the clerk of this court by April 12, 2021.   If the statement is not filed by that time, this petition will be summarily dismissed.  No further time extensions will be granted.  Mr Hyatt is also reminded of his obligation to either pay the filing fee or file a petition to waive the fee, as set forth in this court's March 4, 2021 order.
Receipt of Petition for Review received by Wisconsin Supreme Court on 03/04/21
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration is denied.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this appeal is dismissed.
IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is placed on hold pending a decision in appal no. 2020AP363-CR.
IT IS ORDERED that the appellant's brief shall be filed within thirty days of the date of this order
IT IS ORDERED that the appellant's brief shall be filed within forty days of the date of this order
IT IS ORDERED that this appeal is dismissed for failure to file a brief.

IT IS ORDERED the petition for review is dismissed.  The subject of a petition for review must be the final decision of the court of appeals.  In Interest of A.R., 85 Wis. 2d 444, 270 N.W.2d 581 (1978).  The court of appeals has not yet rendered its final decision.
IT IS ORDERED that the motion for reconsideration is DENIED.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the time to file the appellant's brief is extended to July 1, 2020.
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is Denied
IT IS ORDERED that the motion is denied

IT IS ORDERED that the request is granted.   The prisoner is indigent and has authorized in writing the agency having custody of the prisoner's prison trust fund account to forward payments from the prisoner's account to the clerk of this court each time the amount in the account exceeds $10 until the fee is paid in full.  Wis Stat 814.29(1m)(c).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the agency having custody of the prisoner's trust fund account shall freeze the prisoner's trust fund account while such payments are being made and shall forward the payments to the clerk of this court as provided by law.  The filing fee for this action is $195.00.  When remitting payments, please note this court's case number on all checks.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this action may be commenced without the pre-payment of the filing fee.  If the prisoner receives a money judgment or monetary settlement, the amount shall be used to pay the filing fee for this action which has not yet been reimbursed pursuant to the priority schedule in Wis Stat 806.025(2).

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Brian William Severson. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim Witness Coordinator in court.

Exhibit #1 is marked on behalf of the Plaintiff prior to Court.

FTR:  1:32:52 pm
Court calls the case.  Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
This is set for a continued restitution hearing.

Court reviews the file.
Court questions the State re: if there was a release signed by the victim.
Victim Witness Coordinator makes statements to the Court.
Court questions Victim Witness Coordinator.

Court places a call to S. Stark from the Crime Victim Compensation Program.
Court swears in the witness.
Direct examination by Atty Knaapen.
Cross examination by Atty Severson.
Examination by Court.

Atty Knaapen makes statements to the Court and provides Exhibit #1 to the Court for the file.

Atty Knaapen makes arguments to the Court.
Atty Severson makes arguments to the Court.

BY THE COURT:
Court will give the State sixty days to get the medical records so the Court can see what the diagnosis and treatment was.  Court will evaluate those records once received, or will deny the claim if not received.

Atty Severson makes arguments to the Court re: viewing the medical records if the Court grants the full amount.

BY THE COURT:
Court will review the in-camera inspection statutes and if the statutes permit, the Court will permit Atty Severson to view them.

Court suspects the State will be able to get the medical release signed by the victim.
Atty Knaapen suspects they will be able to do that. 

FTR:  2:13:45 pm

1:58:24 
Case is called and appearances stated on the record.
Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Brian William Severson.  David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court questions the defendant's attorney re: requests.  Denies all requests.
ADA responds to the court indicating he has not received any basis for the restitution requests.  
State is not ready to proceed without having a basis and not wish to inconvenience the witnesses without knowing the basis.
Attorney Severson makes statement in reply to the state.
ADA Knaapen makes additional statement to the court.  
Court responds to the parties.  
Attorney Severson responds to whether they are disputing the amount to the victim.  Court briefly reviews claims in the court's file.  

Court asks the State to provide statements from Crime Victim Compensation, statements from treating doctors and provide within 30 days to the court and defense.  Court will provide a written decision based on those records.  

Court states a finding on the record.  Court give the parties 2 weeks to provide a statement in response to the material provided.   
Court states the defense can cross examine the witnesses after receiving documentation but must notify the court
FCC will not draft an order to the Court until the larger claim is determine.

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Brian William Severson. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Exhibits #1-#3 are marked on behalf of the Plaintiff prior to the start of Court.

1:30 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Court has received the PSI report.
Parties have previously been sent out the report.

State received their copy, has no corrections to state.

Atty Severson has received a copy as well, has corrections to make, for the record.
1:34 PM Atty Knaapen addresses the Court as to the agent appearing by phone to make any corrections if necessary.
Court will let Atty Severson to continue at this time.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, the agent is available and if there are questions raised, that the agent may be contacted.

1:51 PM Clerk calls agent with phone number given by the State.
1:53 PM Agent is on the phone, the author of the PSI.
Court questions Agent for clarifications.
Agent explains.
1:58 PM Atty Severson questions Agent.
(Agent remains on the phone)

2:02 PM Atty Severson addresses the Court.

2:03 PM B Hyatt is called and given Oath.
Mr. Hyatt addresses the Court.

Atty Severson has no further witnesses.

State files a written impact statement, in addition to the statement that was provided in the PSI.
Restitution summary is also filed. 

State has no witnesses but victim would like to make a statement.
State refers to the three exhibits, explains what the exhibits are.
Atty Severson has no objections.

BY THE COURT:
Exhibits #1-#3 are offered and received.

State has complied with victim notification statutes.

2:18 PM Victim addresses the Court.

2:19 PM Court takes a moment to review the victim impact statement.
Defendant is taken to use the facilities.
2:22 PM Defendant returns to courtroom.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Severson addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Court addresses Atty Severson with regards to an open charge/case of Defendant, clarifies.
3:13 PM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing while standing.
Defendant requests a restitution hearing.
3:32 PM Atty Knaapen addresses the Court.
3:33 PM Defendant continues addressing the Court, now while seated.

3:41 PM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.
Court appreciates the victims being present and Defendant's father being present.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 8 years
Initial Confinement for 5 years
Extended Supervision for 3 years
Consecutive to any other sentence Defendant is currently serving
Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Not Eligible for substance abuse program 
320 days credit already served
Conditions:
Court will order restitution but will give time for Defendant to review the claim, will give 30 days in which to respond
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment and with only consent of agent
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances 
Obtain AODA & comply with treatment recommendations
Complete Domestic Violence Treatment Program
Particiate in and comply with Cognitive Intervention Treatment Program
Obtain a psychological evaluation and comply with treatment recommendations as recommended by the agent
Participate in and comply with other assessments and treatment as recommended by the agent
Once released obtain and maintain full time employment
Make monthly payments toward restitution if there is restitution and court ordered obligations
No contact with J. N. or her family or her residence or their places of employment except that Defendant may write a letter of apology and present to agent
Provide DNA Sample
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 5:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 5 years
Initial Confinement for 3 years
Extended Supervision for 2 years
Consecutive to Count 2
Not eligible for challenge incarceration program
Not Eligible for substance abuse program 
320 days credit already served
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 6:
Determinate Prison Sentence for a period of 5 years

Extended Supervision for 2 years
Consecutive to Count 2 and Count 5

Appeal rights are addressed
Sentencing hearing on November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Brian William Severson. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Set for Motion Hearing to Withdraw Plea(s).

3:00 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Defendant is informed that if he has an attorney that his attorney will need to file any motions on his behalf; defendant understands.
Atty Severson states that his client wants to proceed with him as his attorney.
Parties are ready to proceed. 
3:03 p.m.  Defendant is sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Severson. 
Atty Knaapen objects to hearsay; Atty Severson wishes to be heard and makes a statement as to why he is asking these questions.
Defendant is informed to answer the question he is asked.
Atty Severson continues his questioning of his client.
3:35 p.m.  Cross examination by Atty Knaapen.
3:46 p.m.  Re-direct by Atty Severson.
3:53 p.m.  Defendant is excused.  
Court has reviewed the plea hearing transcript.
Court takes Judicial Notice of this case.  Court takes Judicial Notice of the additional facts stated by Atty Severson on the record and that there was a previous file that had been dismissed by the State and re-filed as the 14CF57.
Atty Knaapen states that that is not relevant to this motion.
3:56 p.m.  Atty Severson gives his argument on his motion.
Court makes statements that there was a withdrawal of counsel by Atty Jazgar but no withdrawal of plea's discussed at that motion hearing.
4:06 p.m.  Atty Knaapen gives his argument on this motion.
4:17 p.m.  Atty Severson responds to the argument of Atty Knaapen.
Court questions the parties if they have anything else they would like to put on the record.
Neither party has anything else that they would like to put on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for Plea Withdrawal is DENIED.
Court provides Atty Severson with a copy of the PSI. 
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant's Motion to Withdraw Pleas filed by Atty Brian Severson

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Thomas J. Zoesch. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agent Kim Bast appears by telephone.

1:33 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Matter is set for a sentencing today.

Atty Zoesch addresses the Court, believes there is a good reason to not go forward with sentencing today, for reasons stated on the record. Atty Zoesch was informed by his client that he wants to withdraw his plea and request for his plea to be withdrawn.  Defendant does not wish to proceed with sentencing.

Atty Zoesch would not be interested to representing him on this level.  

Atty Zoesch stats that Defendant told him that he was not in right frame of mind, did not understand the importance of the plea.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, a sentencing was set in January and during that hearing the Defendant never expressed his request to withdraw the plea. There was discussion about Atty Jazgar withdrawing. Atty Knaapen states that the victim has been here twice already for sentencing, everything has been covered. Defendant had the ability to consult with his attorney. State feels the record is adequate and believes the Court should go forward with sentencing today.

Court addresses the parties, reviews the file, gives a timeline for the record. Court reviews the correspondence.

BY THE COURT:
Court allows Defendant to puruse the request. However, the Court is not going to let this file languish on the calendar and will set for a status conference.

Atty Zoesch requests to be withdrawn.

Court appreciates the victim coming in.  

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, states concerns. 

There is still a cash bond that hasn't been posted yet.

Atty Zoesch will return the PSI to the file. 

State clarifies, bond stands revoked.  Status conference scheduled for April 18, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Sentencing hearing at 04-08-2016 01:30 pm

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:38 am. Court calls case.
Kim Bast with Probation and Parole appears by phone.
Victims have been notified and are present in court.
State is ready to proceed.
Atty Jazgar indicates that the defense is not ready to proceed and that an order for withdrawal of counsel has been filed.
Court questions defendant as to why the defense is not ready to proceed.
Defendant makes statements.
Atty Jazgar indicates that the motion to withdrawal was filed a the defendants request and makes additional statements.
Atty Jazgar indicates that he is not prepared to proceed today.
Court questions defendant if he still wishes his attorney to withdrawal.
Defendant indicates that he does.
Court gives an apportunity for the victim to give any statements.
Victim gives statements.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds there has been a breakdown in communication and allows Atty Jazgar to withdrawal.
Court has revoked defendants bond previously and remains revoked. Defendant will not be released.

Atty Jazgar questions if an order may be signed exparte.
All parties agree.

Agent will be able to appear by phone.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing hearing at 12-08-2015 03:00 pm

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

4:01 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

State has filed an Amended Information.
Court would put on the record that this case had been set for a Motion Hearing the morning of October 6, 2015 and provides a status of the case.
Court indicates that the Motion Hearing was not held on the morning of October 6, 2015.
Court has received the Amended Information and reviewed.
Atty Jazgar waives reading of the Amended Information.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Dismissed
Count 2 (amended) - No contest 
Count 3 - Dismissed
Count 4 - Dismissed
Count 5 - No contest
Count 6 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Jazgar reserves the right to be able to file documents prior to the sentencing of his client but will not ask the State to file and amended complaint.
State has complied with victim notification.
Atty Knaapen makes a statement regarding a brief Colloquy.
Court questions Atty Jazgar  regarding all offers provided by the State.
Atty Jazgar would like to approach the bench with Atty Knaapen.
4:28 p.m.  Atty Jazgar would like to speak with his client briefly.
Atty Jazgar makes a statement.
Atty Jazgar makes a statement regarding the PSI and request that it be completed by November 24, 2015.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 2, 5 and 6 and Count 1, 3 and 4 are dismissed outright.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked.
Sentencing set for December 8, 2015 at 3:00 p.m.  
PSI ordered and requires it to be provided to the parties by November 24, 2015.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt: Pre-trial conference at 10-06-2015 08:00 am

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in court with attorney Jeffrey Jazgar. Defendant Jason J. Hyatt in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

1:34 p.m.  Court calls case.
Set for multiple motions filed by the defendant.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.
Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding a motion in which he needed to have a witness present.
Atty Jazgar makes statements regarding the Defendant's Voir Dire Motion. 
Court states that they do not do individual Voir Dire; Court not sure what sensitive issues defense is addressing.
Atty Jazgar states the issues on the record that he is concerned about juror's being asked.
Court will not do individual Voir Dire.  Court indicates that the public cannot be excluded from this process including the juror's.
Court makes statements to Atty Jazgar regarding his issue.
Court will address that with the parties prior to the Jury Trial regarding personal/sensitive issues asked of the Juror's.  
1:41 p.m.  BTC:  Motion for Individual Voir Dire is DENIED.
Defendant's Motion for Multiplicity - Atty Jazgar has nothing to add to this Motion at this time.
Atty Knaapen makes statements regarding this motion.  Atty Jazgar responds.
Court questions Atty Jazgar regarding proceeding under 2 different theories in regards to Counts 1 & 2.  Atty Jazgar responds.
Atty Knaapen responds to Atty Jazgar's statements.  Atty Jazgar does not wish to respond at this time.
1:50 p.m.  BTC:  Motion to Dismiss for Multiplicity  is DENIED.
1:55 p.m. Defendants Motion to Sever Charges. 
Atty Jazgar makes statement; Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Atty Jazgar responds.
Court notes that the witnesses would be the same for the bail jumping charge as well as the other counts; Court makes further statements.
1:58 p.m.  BTC:  Motion to Sever Charges is DENIED.
Atty Jazgar makes further statements and indicates he will discuss this with his client.
1:59 p.m.  Defendant's Motion to Dismiss for Duplicity.
Atty Jazgar makes statements.  Atty Knaapen responds.  Atty Jazgar asks the Court to hold this Motion under advisement for approx. a week and makes further statements.  Atty Jazgar would like to review and if the Court does not hear from him in a week that this motion will be denied.
Court makes statements regarding this motion.
2:04 p.m.  BTC:  Court grants counsel for the defense 1 week to respond to the Motion for Duplicity.
Defendant's Motions in Limine.
Court makes statements and states that both the defense/prosecutor need to follow the Motion's in Limine.
Atty Knaapen makes statements; Atty Jazgar responds.  Atty Knaapen wishes to address #4 on the Motion's in Limine.
Court would like to know if Atty Knaapen will be providing the defense counsel with written documentation of these prior convictions.  Atty Jazgar would like to see the paperwork prior to making a statement.
2:08 p.m.  Defendant's  Motion Restricting Prosecutions Opening & Closing Statements.
Atty Jazgar makes statements.  
BTC:  Informs that both parties will follow the process of the Opening/Closing Statements.
BTC:  Court will order that the witnesses be sequestered except during Voir Dire.
Court makes statements.
Atty Jazgar would like to go back to #2 on Motions in Limine.
Atty Jazgar would like for his client to be in street clothes; Atty Jazgar questions restraints.  Court makes statements.  
2:12 p.m.  Defendant's Motion to Reconsider Motion to Compel and Production of Counseling Records for in Camera Inspection.
Atty Jazgar has nothing to add to this Motion.  Atty Knaapen makes statements.  Atty Jazgar responds.
Court makes statements regarding making a determination of the mental stability of the primary victim; asks Atty Jazgar why he needs the medical records of the victim.  Atty Jazgar makes additional statements.
Court will presume that the witnesses are mentally competent to testify.
BTC:   Court will deny the request for Victim's Counseling Records to be released to the Counsel for the Defense.
Atty Jazgar questions the reliability of the witness (victim).  Court makes statements.   Atty Jazgar has no further argument. 
Atty Jazgar filed additional motion to reserve the right to file additional motions.  Court indicates this is standard.
Court questions the Motion to Suppress Statements.  Court questions Atty Jazgar if he would like a new date regarding statements to suppress.
Atty Jazgar makes statements.  
Court states that this case is set for Trial on October 7, 2015.
Court questions Atty Knaapen as to how many statements they look at addressing to suppress.  Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Atty Jazgar makes statements to set PTC on October 6, 2015 for 8:00 a.m.   Atty Knaapen makes statements.
Atty Jazgar questions the production of the Jury List.  Court makes statements regarding alternate Juror's.  Atty Knaapen makes statements that one alternate should be appropriate.  Atty Jazgar agree's.  Court makes statements regarding the strikes.
Atty Jazgar states the Jury List is available at the Clerk of Court's Office.
 

BY THE COURT:
Additional Motions are to be filed by September 16, 2015 and State will then be allowed to Respond.
PTC set for October 6, 2015 at 8:00 a.m. 

2:30 p.m  Court is in recess.




 





BY THE COURT:  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 6, 2015 at 08:00 am.

Initial appearance on February 24, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment. Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons. Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  J.L.N. with DOB of 03/30/1982, J.H.K. with DOB of 09/05/1990, and J.J.V. with DOB of 08/19/1985. Do not to be on any premises of where these people are. Do not be within 100 yards of their homes. Comply with all bond conditions in any other pending cases Defendant may have. Contact the public defender's office today.

Defendant Jason J. Hyatt appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R. Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.

1:21 PM Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.

Defendant appears by video, without counsel.

Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint, has complaint in front of him now. 
Defendant addresses the Court, is not sure if he will obtain counsel or not.  
Defendant was represented by Atty Hughes on the previous file, public defender appointment.

Defendant is likely qualified for a public defender. 

Defendant intends to contact the office.

Court will set this for a continued initial appearance.

State addresses bond, requests $250,000 cash bond with conditions, for reasons stated on the record.
13CF-408 is a Fond du Lac County case that is pending.

Atty Knaapen addresses the Court, explains the situation. Previous case was dismissed and re-filed for reasons stated on the record.

Court finds probable cause in the complaint.

Defendant reserves comment until there is representation.

Court addresses the parties, feels cash bond is not appropriate. 

Court reminds Defendant to keep the COC's office apprised of any change of address.
